SUMMARY: McbR belongs to group of DNA-binding proteins of GntR/FadR family of bacterial regulators [11756427, 19729089]. It binds as a dimer to its operator site via its winged helix domains [11279025]. It is probable that McbR binds DNA as a dimer [20713450]. McbR (YncC) regulates biofilm formation and mucoidity by repressing expression of mcbA (ybiM) [18309357]. McbA belongs to YhcN family of periplasmic proteins and is induced by quorum-sensing signal autoinducer 2 (AI-2) [11514505, 9588799]. McbR is negatively autoregulated and, in addition, repressed by YgiV [18309357]. Expression of mcbR is induced by overexpression of lsr operon regulators LsrR and LsrK, quorum-sensing regulator MqsR, and AI-2 exporter TqsA [18309357]. McbR carries a helix-turn-helix DNA-binding motif (aa 37-56) and represses transcription of mcbA by binding to promoter region of mcbA [18309357]. McbR: MqsR-controlled colanic acid and biofilm Regulator [18309357].
